thread.title: John Oliver didn't know about his show's site
thread.title_full: John Oliver didn't know about his show's site

title: John Oliver didn't know about his show's site
text:
John Oliver Had No Idea 'Last Week Tonight' Had A Website Briana Altergott , Mikah Sargent 1:54 AM, Oct 1, 2015 
Photo Credit: CBS / 'Late Show' 
John Oliver's hit HBO show, "Last Week Tonight," has a pretty cool website for its viewers to visit in between episodes. 
But, as John admitted to Stephen Colbert on the "Late Show" this week, he wouldn't know. 
"We don't take suggestions from people," John Oliver said on the "Late Show." 
"Really?" asked Stephen Colbert. 
"No," John replied. 
"You have a site! You have a place on your official website for suggestions!" Stephen laughed. 
"I genuinely did not know we had a website," John admitted. 
That's right, when Stephen asked John if he would ever cover topics from the viewers' suggestion section of his official website, he admitted he didn't even know he had a website at all. (Video via HBO / "Last Week Tonight with John Oliver" ) 
For instance, take this Leap Second Countdown Clock that automatically wastes a second of your time with a randomly generated, one-second video. Amazing. 
Fortunately, John's interview with Stephen definitely wasn't a waste of time. 
Viewers at home loved seeing the two back together again, calling the show "fantastic" and "the most awesome thing." 
Here's to hoping we see a lot more of them in the future! And that John learns how to use the Internet. 
This video includes images from Getty Images.
